profile.name: Eleven (Jane Hopper)
profile.summary: Extraordinary individual with unique sensory and perceptual abilities developed through intensive government research programs. Demonstrated crisis leadership and threat assessment capabilities far beyond chronological experience. Currently transitioning from classified research background to civilian applications.

evidence.outcome: Demonstrated remote sensory perception capabilities validated by government researchers
evidence.description: Abilities verified through controlled laboratory testing by Hawkins National Laboratory

evidence.outcome: Identified and neutralized 4 critical threats to civilian population
evidence.description: Threat detection capabilities instrumental in preventing mass casualty events

evidence.outcome: Led crisis response saving 30+ civilian lives across 3 separate incidents
evidence.description: Demonstrated calm under extreme pressure in life-threatening scenarios

evidence.outcome: Recovered and regained full capabilities after complete ability loss
evidence.description: Demonstrated extraordinary psychological resilience following traumatic events

evidence.outcome: Personal experience with institutional trauma informs deep understanding of PTSD
evidence.description: Unique perspective on recovery and resilience from lived experience

workHistory.title: Crisis Response Operative
workHistory.description: Led frontline response to multiple community-threatening events. Coordinated with civilian volunteers and law enforcement. Instrumental in neutralizing existential threats to the town of Hawkins.
achievements: Saved 30+ civilian lives across 3 crisis events
Closed dimensional breach threatening entire community
Rebuilt personal capabilities after traumatic setback

workHistory.title: Research Subject
workHistory.description: Participant in classified government research program studying enhanced human perception. Developed and demonstrated extraordinary sensory capabilities under controlled laboratory conditions.
achievements: Subject of multiple classified research publications

savedJobs.title: Neuroscience Research Associate
savedJobs.description: Support research on sensory perception and brain plasticity in the Department of Neuroscience. Assist with experimental design, data collection, and publication.

savedJobs.title: Crisis Intervention Specialist
savedJobs.description: Provide direct crisis intervention services and support to communities affected by disasters and traumatic events. Deploy as part of federal crisis response teams.

savedJobs.title: Intelligence Analyst
savedJobs.description: Analyze intelligence data to identify threats to national security. Produce analytical reports and brief senior leadership on findings.
